Package edu.bu.pas.stealth.agents

Class AStarAgent

java.lang.Object
edu.cwru.sepia.agent.Agent
edu.bu.pas.stealth.agents.AStarAgent
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public abstract class AStarAgent extends edu.cwru.sepia.agent.Agent
The base type for Agent's that solve mazes in Sepia. AStarAgent provides an api that is necessary for agents that want to move around in the world via a plan calculated via the A* algorithm. Agents in Sepia must override a few abstract methods, most notably initialStep, middleStep, and terminalStep. Two of these methods are handled for you, to both control the Sepia API as well as provide an API for the autograders to use. Here is a description of how the two Sepia methods I implemented for you work: initialStep: This method discovers the unit you control, the enemy base's unit, and all other enemy units present on the map. If you want to discover and keep track of other sepia state information, you will need to override this method. I have already provided an example in your starter code which looks up how far each enemy ranged unit can see. terminalStep: This method prints out the results of the game. There are four possible outcomes: 1) you and the enemy base are both killed. This is a tie. 2) the enemy base is killed and you survive. You win. 3) the enemy base survives and your unit is killed. You lose. 4) you and the enemy base both survive. This is a tie.
See Also:

    • initialStep

      public Map<Integer,edu.cwru.sepia.action.Action> initialStep(edu.cwru.sepia.environment.model.state.State.StateView state, edu.cwru.sepia.environment.model.history.History.HistoryView history)
      A method to discover all units on the map. There should be only one unit you control, one enemy base, and an arbitrary number of additional units the enemy controls. This method, after discovering the ids of these units and setting fields, will call search to find the plan from your unit's current location to a coordinate adjacent to the enemy base.
      Specified by:
      initialStep in class edu.cwru.sepia.agent.Agent
      Parameters:
      state - The initial state of the game.
      history - The initial history of the game.
      Returns:
      This method returns null and relies on middlestep to do any movement.

    • terminalStep

      public void terminalStep(edu.cwru.sepia.environment.model.state.State.StateView state, edu.cwru.sepia.environment.model.history.History.HistoryView history)
      A method to print out the outcome of the game. There are four possible outcomes: 1) both your unit and the enemy base are killed. This is a tie. 2) the enemy base is killed and you survive. You win. 3) the enemy base survives and your unit is killed. You lose. 4) both the enemy base as well as you survive. This is a tie.
      Specified by:
      terminalStep in class edu.cwru.sepia.agent.Agent
      Parameters:
      state - The last state of the game.
      history - The entire history of the game.

    • getDirectionToMoveTo

      public edu.cwru.sepia.util.Direction getDirectionToMoveTo(Vertex a, Vertex b)
      A helper method to calculate the sepia Direction needed to go from coordinate "a" to coordiante "b". This method will return null (and print out an error) if the two coordinates are not adjacent.
      Parameters:
      a - The initial coordinate to move from.
      b - The desired coordinate to move to.
      Returns:
      The sepia Direction that would be necessary to go from coordinate "a" to coordinate "b". Will be null if the two coordinates are not adjacent.

    • getHeuristicValue

      public float getHeuristicValue(Vertex v, Vertex goal, edu.cwru.sepia.environment.model.state.State.StateView state)
      A helper method to calculate the heuristic value of a vertex (i.e. an estimate of the remaining path cost) to the goal state. This is calculated as the euclidean distance (i.e. straight line distance) between the coordinates of the squares on the map.
      Parameters:
      v - The Vertex to find the heuristic value of.
      goal - The goal Vertex
      state - The current sepia state of the game.
      Returns:
      The euclidean distance between the two vertices.

    • getNeighbors

      public abstract Collection<Vertex> getNeighbors(Vertex v, edu.cwru.sepia.environment.model.state.State.StateView state, AStarAgent.ExtraParams extraParams)
      A helper method to determine to get the collection of Vertex objects that are neighbors of the input Vertex. Neighbor vertices must have coordinates that are in bounds of the map, cannot be occupied by a resource (i.e. a Tree or Gold), and also cannot be occupied by a unit. An exception is made for the enemy base's unit, we allow a Vertex that is occupied by the enemy base to appear in a neighborhood. This is so that the our graph search algorithm will find the enemy base's location (since it is used as the goal Vertex when infiltrating). The enemy base will be dead (i.e. not present on the map) when exfiltrating, so we do not have to worry about trying to move into an occupied square when exfiltrating.
      Parameters:
      v - The Vertex to find the neighbors of
      state - The current sepia state of the game.
      extraParams - Any extra parameters you decide are necessary to determine a neighborhood.
      Returns:
      A collection of Vertex objects that are considered adjacent to the input.

    • aStarSearch

      public abstract Path aStarSearch(Vertex src, Vertex dst, edu.cwru.sepia.environment.model.state.State.StateView state, AStarAgent.ExtraParams extraParams)
      A method for the A* graph traversal algorithm that computes the path from the src coordinate to the dst coordinate using the Path datatype.
      Parameters:
      src - The source coordinate
      dst - The destination coordinate
      state - The sepia State.StateView used to lookup useful information about the state of the world.
      extraParams - Any extra parameters you decide are necessary to determine a neighborhood.
      Returns:
      A Path object that implements a path from the src coordinate to the dst coordinate Reminder that if the dst coordinate cannot actually be occupied by your unit, then you will need to deal with that when executing your path.

    • getEdgeWeight

      public abstract float getEdgeWeight(Vertex src, Vertex dst, edu.cwru.sepia.environment.model.state.State.StateView state, AStarAgent.ExtraParams extraParams)
      An abstract method to calculate the edge weight between a source Vertex to a destination Vertex. This edge weight can be a function of what is happening in the game currently, and is a nice way to encode "risk". The can incentivize A* to use this edge in a path by making the edge weight small, and we can discourage A* from using this edge in a path by making the edge weight large. So, we can assign large edge weights when taking that edge leads to bad scenarios (like going to a place thats close to the enemy units), etc. and we can assign smaller weights when taking that edge leads to good scenarios.

      Just remember that we are using euclidean distance, which must be admissible and consistent in this world. Typically I ask you to design a heuristic that is admissible and consistent where we already know the edge weights. Here we must work backwards. In order for euclidean distance to be admissible, an edge weight cannot be < 1, so make sure your edge weights are ^gt;= 1! I'll leave it up to you to make sure your edge weights allow euclidean distance to be consistent.

      Parameters:
      src - The source Vertex of the edge being considered.
      dst - The destination Vertex of the edge being considered.
      state - The sepia State.StateView used to lookup things like coordinate occupancy, etc.
      extraParams - Any extra parameters you decide are necessary to calculate an edge weight.
      Returns:
      The floating point edge weight of the edge (src -> dst). Reminder that these edge weights cannot break the admissibility and consistency of our heuristic (euclidean distance).

    • shouldReplacePlan

      public abstract boolean shouldReplacePlan(edu.cwru.sepia.environment.model.state.State.StateView state, AStarAgent.ExtraParams extraParams)
      An abstract method to determine if the current plan is still valid. Plans can become invalid for a variety of reasons: maybe something has moved in the world and is now blocking one of the coordinates you intend to traverse, or maybe the plan takes your unit too close to an enemy that will kill it, etc. If this method returns true, it would be wise for you to replan. Note that this method should be far cheaper to run than a full replan, so we would want to call this method (potentially) every turn of the game and only replan whenever this method says to do so.
      Parameters:
      state - The current State.StateView of the game.
      extraParams - Any extra parameters you think are necessary to determine if the current plan is still valid.
      Returns:
      true if the current plan should be recalculated, false otherwise.
